page.title: 15A Village Entertainer (1)
page.content: Charles William Showers was born at Hambridge in 1906.As a boy he worked on a farm,cleaning boots,shoes and leggings.For this he was paid 2d a day.He left this work and began withy stripping before and after school.In 1919 he started work on a farm where he acquired many skills:driving horses,hedging,thatching,tractor driving,milking,pig_husbandry and ploughing.Charlie married in 1929 and moved to Whitecross,Drayton.Already known as a good singer,he was invited to join the wassailers.On Old Twelth Night a small group of men visit homes and sing traditional folk songs and in return receive food,drink and money for charity.The repetoire includes:Richard of Taunton Deane,A Carter's Life,The Derby Ram,Old Ale,When be us getting married then? Billy Buckle and the Wassail Song.
